instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related study to detect moldy core of apples?
Output: The related study used visible spectrum and near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) spectrum to detect moldy core of apples.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related study to detect moldy core of apples?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used in the study were Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA), Mahalanobis Distance (MD), k-nearest neighbor (KNN), Partial Least Squares Discriminant Analysis (PLS-DA), Extreme Learning Machine (ELM), and Support Vector Machine (SVM).

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the models in the related study to detect moldy core of apples and how far can this metric go?
Output: The specific metric chosen to evaluate the models to detect moldy core of apples was classification accuracy. The best result can reach 93.75% in the related study.

instruction: What machine learning algorithms were used to predict moldy core of apples in the study?
Output: The machine learning algorithms used to predict moldy core of apples in the study were extreme learning machine (ELM) and support vector machine (SVM).

instruction: How does the accuracy rate of the PLS-DA modeling method compare to traditional methods in detecting moldy core of apples using visible near-infrared spectroscopy?
Output: The accuracy rate of the PLS-DA modeling method in detecting moldy core of apples using visible near-infrared spectroscopy is higher than traditional methods. According to the study, the accuracy rate of the PLS-DA model for the stem upward and stem downward postures was 93.75%, while the accuracy of the other two postures was more than 85%. This indicates that PLS-DA is an effective method for distinguishing moldy core of apples.
